comments:
Test Scenario - JVEWRKB01 - Test Visual Editor interactions with the Eclipse 
workbench

This is one of the last testcases in the scenario:
Switch to the Resource perspective. 
Create a new Visual Class extending JPanel. 
Set the background color of the JPanel to blue. 
Save the class. 
Open a new window (Window menu -> New Window) 
Switch the new window to the Java perspective. 
Open the new class with the Java editor. 
Change the color line in the source to red. 

When you execute the last step change the background color to red, the 
following exceptions are thrown (nothing visually shows in error in the editor):

!MESSAGE Exception
!STACK 1
Java Model Exception: Java Model Status [[Working copy] JPanel1.java [in 
[default] [in [project root] [in VE TestPass 1]]] does not exist.]

Don't want to be pointing fingers, but wrong kind of java model. It is the JDT,
and not the JEM (which is the EMF model). It is also in codegen, so I'm
switching this defect to there.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 46272 ***
M1 released, move all resolved to Verified, as prelude to closing.
M1 released, move all resolved/verified to Closed.
